text:
What's up everyone I'm so excited for today's 
lesson because we're learning English with the

legendary English band The Beatles! Now I'm a huge 
fan of The Beatles they really are on a different

level to other artists and their music is timeless 
meaning is popular today and will not be affected

by time or fashion. In this lesson you'll learn 
with a scene we've selected from an interview

of theirs and then you'll also learn lots of 
vocabulary and expressions with a conversation

I have with Ethan. Finally you'll get to practice 
your speaking by having a conversation with me

and then watch without subtitles and test 
your knowledge with some quiz questions.

Because every week we help you to learn English 
without getting lost, without missing the jokes

and without subtitles just like Dave who says 
that our channel has given him the confidence

that every skill can be learned with dedication 
and determination. So make sure you hit that

subscribe button and the bell down below that way 
you won't miss a single one of our new lessons.

We are so happy we are about to reach four million 
subscribers here on Learn English with TV Series

and to celebrate we are giving away for free our 
Fluent with Friends Premium Course. In our Fluent

with Friends Course we'll teach you important 
vocabulary just like this to help you avoid

making mistakes of course in addition to learning 
thousands of words we really use in our everyday

speech, understanding how natives really speak 
using correct pronunciation and laughing along

with all the jokes.To participate just go to our 
Instagram Real Life dot English. Best of luck!

If you're enjoying this lesson I highly 
recommend you check out this lesson we

made with another legendary 
band Queen. You can click up

here or down in the description 
box below to watch that next.

I'm going to teach you some words that you can 
use to talk about The Beatles or any other artist

or band that's popular. Today then we'll play a 
conversation Ethan and I had using these words.

We already explained what flop means it could 
be a song that doesn't end up becoming popular

the opposite of that is hit. A word that's 
often attached to The Beatles is legacy

they were so influential even often regarded as 
the most influential band of all time that their

music served as inspiration to many artists 
and bands that came after them. Part of that

legacy is probably the way their fans or fanbase 
interacted with The Beatles. Their fans were so

enthusiastic about them that it became a sort of 
phenomenon that received the name of Beatlemania.

In this section of the lesson we'll replace 
some parts from my conversation with Ethan.

Then we'll give you a few seconds to answer 
using the suggested phrases on screen
you may reply in your own unique way too.

If you do that just include the phrase in 
blue so that it's connected with the reply.

So it's funny how in that video they don't seem to 
have overly high expectations for their career

Nothing the beatles did ever flopped. So he 
was a bit off in his prediction they put out

hit after hit after hit the legacy that John 
Paul George and Ringo left is incomparable.
So what are some of your favorite songs by them.

Well two of my favorites are I'm Only 
Sleeping and Tomorrow Never Knows

they experimented with playing music backwards and 
used the sitar a lot after their trip to India.

I hope you enjoyed that speaking practice with 
me. I certainly enjoyed speaking with you.

So now you'll get to watch what you've 
learned without subtitles and test your

knowledge with some quiz questions. Don't 
forget to give us a like and also let me

know down in the comments which is 
your favorite song by The Beatles
